class.name: Word.ReviewerCollection
class.description: A collection of Word.Reviewer objects that represents the reviewers of one or more documents. The ReviewerCollection object contains the names of all reviewers who have reviewed documents opened or edited on a computer.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the reviewer collection's context to verify the connection to the Office host application and log its debug information.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Get and display all reviewer names from the current document's reviewer collection.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Returns a Reviewer object that represents the specified item in the collection.

examples.description: Get the first reviewer from the collection and display their name in the console.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the names of all reviewers who have made changes to the document

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ReviewerCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ReviewerCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Export reviewer information to JSON format for logging or external storage purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track all reviewers in the document to maintain references across multiple sync calls while processing reviewer information

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this

examples.description: Release memory for a ReviewerCollection object after retrieving and displaying reviewer information to prevent memory leaks
